folder: racetracks & Gravesend Race Track., Brooklyn, NY
text:
Gravesend Race Track (Brooklyn): Shown is a view of the remaining sheds of the Brooklyn Jockey Club's race track, which lay on the east side of McDonald Avenue, extending east to Ocean Parkway and north and south from slightly below Avenue U to Kings Highway. This photograph was taken from McDonald Avenue, just above Avenue U, and is in a north-easterly direction. The track in the foreground is of the B. M. T. system.

April, 1923

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
title: Brooklyn: racetracks - Gravesend Race Track.

folder: McDonald Avenue & Avenue U, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Mo Donald Ave., (general view) between Ave. U, and Neck Road, looking southeastward. To the right, are the rears of homes facing on Neck Road. at the extreme left, is partially seen the Gravesend Dutch Reformed Church.
June 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: McDonald Avenue & Avenue U, Brooklyn, NY
text:
McDonald Ave., at the N.E. corner of Ave. U. The view shows a frame house used by the Italian American Tammany Club.

March 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
